DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identification number of the Beam. The value of Beam Number (300A,00C0) shall be unique within the RT Plan in which it is created.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: IS: A string of characters representing an Integer in base-10 (decimal), shall contain only the listed characters (0-9, +,-). [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::12:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/9/13 changed data type to number for reuse in CRF Standard. jc  1/6/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: PS 3.3 - page 675. Note 1: Beam Number (300A,00C0) is provided to link related information across modules, and its value should not be required to have any real-world interpretation. Beam Name (300A,00C2), a Type 3 attribute, is intended to store the primary beam identifier (often referred to as 'field identifier'). Beam Description (300A,00C3), a Type 3 attribute, is intended to store additional beam identifying information (often referred to as 'field name'). Equipment supporting both these attributes should state this clearly in the Conformance Statement.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Reference
ReferenceDocuments.description: PS 3.3-2011: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), Part 3: Information Object Definitions
